intro: Bridelia verrucosa, commonly known as the rough bridelia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
